Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System - Cefazolin 0.5-32 μg/mL
BD Phoenix™ Automated Microbiology System cefazolin (0.5-32 μg/mL) Gram-Negative ID/AST or AST
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Specimen Type(s): Isolates from pure culture of most aerobic and facultative anaerobic gram-negative and gram-positive bacteria of human origin
Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System for in vitro antimicrobial susceptibility testing using cefazolin panels for gram-negative bacteria
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility (MIC) of most Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria isolates and most Gram-positive bacteria isolates from pure culture for Enterobacteriaceae, Non-Enterobacteriaceae, and Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, Streptococcus, using cefazolin 0.5-32 μg/mL in Phoenix panels
